definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
abbr. for Heilongjiang province 黑龍江|黑龙江[Hei1 long2 jiang1]

sentences.english: Shouted the old black females was such a big deal, the front of the neighbors were awakened.
sentences.chinese: 老黑母兔這麼一喊不要緊，把跟前的鄰居們都驚醒了。

sentences.english: I was the black dude reading Bukowski's Post Office.
sentences.chinese: 我是那個老黑，正在讀布考斯基的《郵局》。

sentences.english: Old black females crawl up from the ground up.
sentences.chinese: 老黑母兔從地上爬起來。

definition: (onom.) quack/honk/(northern dialect) very/also pr. [ga1 ga5], [ga2 ga5] etc
Xiaojin county (Tibetan: btsan lha rdzong) in Ngawa Tibetan and Qiang autonomous prefecture 阿壩藏族羌族自治州|阿坝藏族羌族自治州[A1 ba4 Zang4 zu2 Qiang1 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], northwest Sichuan
see 老頭子|老头子[lao3 tou2 zi5]
elder brother (often used self-referentially)/(form of address between male friends) old chap/buddy
(coll.) old man/(said of an aging husband) my old man
